noun.description: Hot fluid or semifluid material below or within the earth's crust from which lava and other igneous rock is formed on cooling.
examples: when red-hot magma comes into contact with seawater, an explosion results
basaltic magmas are normally expelled at the surface in a very hot and fluid state

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense residue of dregs after evaporation or pressing of a semiliquid substance): via Latin from Greek magma (from massein knead).
